node.title: 'Freedom, independence, jobs': Motorbike program kickstarts change for young riders
node.alt: A young woman crouched in front of a green motorbike, smiling to camera.
node.description: A motorcycle training program targeting young, unlicensed riders helps them ride safely and legally.
node.content:
["Three years ago, Chigwell, on the outskirts of Hobart, was not a peaceful place.", "\"Local residents\u00a0informed us of the illegal riding of motorbikes \u2014 the wheel-stands and the bad behaviour,\" Bucaan Community House manager\u00a0Linda Kemp said.\u00a0", "\"So, we rounded up the kids \u2026\u00a0that we knew were the culprits\u00a0and put our heads together with the Glenorchy City Council to see if we could get some sort of program together to \u2026\u00a0make them ride\u00a0legally and\u00a0safely.\"", "The result was a motorcycle training program that has now trained 60 young riders.", "\"The [young law-breakers]\u00a0helped instigate what they needed \u2026\u00a0and they've all continued to abide by the law since the program,\u00a0which is a great outcome.\"", "
Straight to the source
", "Young unlicensed riders on unregistered bikes\u00a0without\u00a0safety gear\u00a0are\u00a0\"over-represented in the [road accident] stats\" across Australia, according to Conrad Gilbey.", "He coordinates a Chigwell-based initiative called the Full Gear Project that began with\u00a0community authorities sitting down with young law-breaking riders to ask them\u00a0why they had been riding unsafely.", "It turned out\u00a0most of the riders, including Jemimah Whiteway,\u00a0could not\u00a0afford to\u00a0get\u00a0a licence or\u00a0buy\u00a0safety equipment, but still needed \"wheels to get to a job\".", "\"Learners' tests cost\u00a0about six weeks' worth of [casual] work with\u00a0no spending,\" Ms Whiteway said.", "\"So, there's no way I would have been able to get the money.\"", "She and many of the other young riders were dependent on lifts from others to get to work, or on buses if they were available.", "Tom French, 18, said his work was\u00a0an hour from his residence and the only way he could get there was by carpooling, meaning he sometimes missed work \"because of little things going on with other people\".", "The young riders' ideas about what could help to solve their problems\u00a0became the basis of Full Gear's training program.", "", "
Conrad Gilbey says\u00a0many young people\u00a0in the program bring\u00a0a lot\u00a0of riding experience with them.(Supplied: Bucaan Community House)
", "
Nuts and bolts
", "The state-funded program\u00a0has now been running for three years.", "As well as\u00a0classroom lessons, the program provides participants with a learner licence test and\u00a0$400 worth of safety gear for free.", "", "
Course participants are given a voucher to spend on\u00a0motorbike safety gear.(ABC Northern Tasmania: Sarah Abbott)
", "Mr Gilbey said the\u00a0principle was that everyone who entered the program would pass it.\u00a0", "\"So no matter what it takes \u2014\u00a0if they need extra classes or literacy support \u2014\u00a0everyone's going to get through, and they have.\"", "Support for some participants has\u00a0also involved program staff\u00a0helping\u00a0them\u00a0get to class or to a test\u00a0on time by knocking on their doors, and always being available to \"talk\u00a0about anything\".", "\"Their trust in us is so valuable and if they want to talk about\u00a0[what's] going on at home, we\u2019re there for them.\"", "", "
Linda Kemp says\u00a011 out of 18 of the first participants were able to find jobs because of the program.(ABC Northern Tasmania: Sarah Abbott)
", "
Big and small wins
", "Mr Gilbey said the relationships formed during the program meant past participants\u00a0often came back\u00a0to \"share their successes\".", "He mentioned one young woman\u00a0who dropped into the Bucaan Community House with the motorcycle she had just bought.", "\"She was so chuffed that she got a brand new motorbike \u2014\u00a0she'd been saving up for it for ages \u2014\u00a0that's a huge success,\" Mr Gilbey said.", "\"Another thing that's so important is [participants]\u00a0get an experience of mastery.", "\"Because of the difficulty of getting a licence, the\u00a0feeling of accomplishment accompanying\u00a0that is a big deal for them.\"", "", "
Mr Gilbey, a rider himself, enjoys swapping\u00a0\"real-life\" riding stories with the young riders.(ABC Northern Tasmania: Sarah Abbott)
", "The freedom to ride that a licence provides also means\u00a0many program participants have been able to find\u00a0work, or increase\u00a0their work hours.", "Ms Whiteway, who worked casually in a shopping centre before the program, now works full-time in aviation safety at Hobart airport.", "\"None of that would have happened at all without having a licence to get here to start with,\" she said.", "Mr French said the program had \"changed everything\" for him.", "\"I went from walking and bussing everywhere to going everywhere by bike,\" he said.", "\"Being able to rely on myself now \u2026\u00a0no more carpooling or worrying about any of that stuff.", "\"It's been really good having the independence\u00a0[and] now I go on tours all around Tassie.\u00a0I go wherever I like.", "\"You just feel free \u2014\u00a0it's awesome.\"", "
Expanding horizons
", "Having so far only\u00a0been run in\u00a0southern Tasmania, in\u00a0Chigwell, New Newfolk and Gagebrook, the Full Gear motorbike training program will soon also be starting up in Launceston, in the state's north.", "Mr Gilbey said the program\u00a0will also extend to offering riders their Ps, and include\u00a0instruction on \"advanced riding techniques\", as well as\u00a0free professional motorbike safety checks.", "", "
From February 2022, the program will also train riders in Tasmania's north.(Supplied: Bucaan Community House)
", "Back in\u00a0Chigwell, success of the program in terms of improved road safety outcomes is difficult to establish due to a\u00a0lack of statistics specific to the area.", "\"But I have spoken to a police officer in this area recently, and motorcycle deaths in this [young] age group are down,\" Mr Gilbey said.", "Data aside, Ms Kemp says the streets of Chigwell have become much quieter.", "\"There\u2019s less bad road use with the kids on the bikes \u2014\u00a0they're not just riding anywhere and everywhere,\" she said.", "\"A chap that lives down here in Chigwell, he often comes back, and he tells us he doesn\u2019t know how we did it, but we stopped a lot of the illegal riding with the program that we ran.\""]
